name: gael
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person of Celtic origin who speaks Gaelic (= a group of languages spoken in parts of Ireland and Scotland) or whose family spoke Gaelic: The Gaels have a phrase for a cold spell in early May. Gaels dominate folk music.
More examplesFewer examplesMany Scots Gaels emigrated to Nova Scotia in the 18th century.The Romans never invaded Ireland so the Gaels remained isolated. If you're not born Gaelic you'll never be a Gael.
